Description: Practice Fusion Inc., a San Francisco-based health information technology developer, entered into a deferred prosecution agreement and agreed to pay $145 million to resolve criminal and civil investigations relating to its electronic health records software. As part of the criminal resolution, Practice Fusion admitted that it solicited and received kickbacks from a major opioid company in exchange for utilizing its software to influence physician prescribing of opioid pain medications.

Practice Fusion agreed to pay $118.6 million to resolve multistate litigation alleging that the company accepted payments from specific drug manufacturers in exchange for promoting their drugs to physicians using Practice Fusion software. This was part of a larger $145 million settlement involving the federal government (see separate entry).
